instructions.1: Grease two 9-inch pie plates and set aside.
instructions.2: Make pastry: Pulse flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a food processor several times until combined. Add cold butter and pulse until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add egg and vanilla; process until dough holds together, about 30 seconds.
instructions.3: Transfer dough to a well-floured work surface, divide in half, and roll each piece into a 9-inch round crust. Fit crusts into the prepared pie plates and freeze for 1 hour.
instructions.4: Make filling: Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan; stir in rice and return to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and cook until rice has absorbed water, about 20 minutes.
instructions.5: Stir milk into rice and bring to a simmer; cook until thickened, stirring often, about 10 minutes. Set aside to cool.
instructions.6: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
instructions.7: Beat together ricotta cheese, eggs, sugar, lemon juice, and lemon zest in a large bowl until smooth. Stir in cooled rice mixture and crushed pineapple until thoroughly combined.
instructions.8: Divide filling between frozen pie crusts.
instructions.9: Bake in the preheated oven until filling is set and the tops are golden brown, about 1 hour 30 minutes. Cool on wire racks.
